    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add​(Collection<? extends IndexEntryUpdate<?>> updates,
                PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Description copied from interface: IndexPopulator
        Called when initially populating an index over existing data. Guaranteed to be called by the same thread every time. All data coming in here is guaranteed to not have been added to this index previously, so no checks needs to be performed before applying it. Implementations may verify constraints at this time, or defer them until the first verification of IndexPopulator.verifyDeferredConstraints(NodePropertyAccessor).
        Specified by:
        add in interface IndexPopulator
        Overrides:
        add in class LuceneIndexPopulator<DatabaseIndex<FulltextIndexReader>>
        Parameters:
        updates - batch of node property updates that needs to be inserted. Node ids will be retrieved using IndexEntryUpdate.getEntityId() method and property values will be retrieved using IndexEntryUpdate.values() method.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cache events tracer

      • verifyDeferredConstraints

        public void verifyDeferredConstraints​(NodePropertyAccessor propertyAccessor)
        Description copied from interface: IndexPopulator
        Verifies that each value in this index is unique. This method is called after the index has been fully populated and is guaranteed to not have concurrent changes while executing.
        Parameters:
        propertyAccessor - NodePropertyAccessor for accessing properties from database storage in the event of conflicting values.

      • newPopulatingUpdater

        public IndexUpdater newPopulatingUpdater​(NodePropertyAccessor accessor,
                                         PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Description copied from interface: IndexPopulator
        Return an updater for applying a set of changes to this index, generally this will be a set of changes from a transaction. Index population goes through the existing data in the graph and feeds relevant data to this populator. Simultaneously as population progresses there might be incoming updates from committing transactions, which needs to be applied as well. This populator will only receive updates for nodes that it already has seen. Updates coming in here must be applied idempotently as the same data may have been added previously . Updates can come in two different IndexEntryUpdate.updateMode() modes}.
        1. UpdateMode.ADDED means that there's an added property to a node already seen by this populator and so needs to be added. Note that this addition needs to be applied idempotently.
        2. UpdateMode.CHANGED means that there's a change to a property for a node already seen by this populator and that this new change needs to be applied. Note that this change needs to be applied idempotently.
        3. UpdateMode.REMOVED means that a property already seen by this populator or even the node itself has been removed and need to be removed from this index as well. Note that this removal needs to be applied idempotently.
        Parameters:
        accessor - accesses property data if implementation needs to be able look up property values while populating.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cache events tracer
        Returns:
        an IndexUpdater which will funnel changes that happen concurrently with index population into the population and incorporating them as part of the index population.

      • includeSample

        public void includeSample​(IndexEntryUpdate<?> update)
        Description copied from interface: IndexPopulator
        Add the given update to the sampler for this index.
        Parameters:
        update - update to include in sample

      • sample

        Returns:
